alert.note: Alert for Macomb (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 1:35AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Macomb County through 200 AM EDT... At 135 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sterling Heights, or near Troy, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Clinton around 140 AM EDT. Mount Clemens and Macomb Township around 145 AM EDT. St. Clair Shores around 150 AM EDT. New Baltimore around 155 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Roseville, Shelby Township, Chesterfield Township, Clinton Township, Utica, Fraser and Washington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
